name: articleRelatedContent
description: on = shows the related content component in an article, off = hides it from the user

name: ads
description: on = shows the ads component, off = hides it from the user

name: clientAjaxErrorReporting
description: sends more frequent and detailed ajax request error reports to sentry

name: clientErrorReporting
description: on = sends client side errors to sentry, off = turns off the error handling

name: clientDetailedErrorReporting
description: Turns on more detailed contextual information for client side errors

name: follow
description: following of topics

name: saveForLater
description: saving an article for later

name: javascript
description: on = client side javascript will run, off = no client side javascript will run

name: polyfills
description: on = The polyfill service will be requested, off = There will be no polyfills and non-core features will not work in some browsers

name: beacon
description: on = enables tracking to the next click-side web beacon, off = disables beacon tracking

name: oTracking
description: on = enables the o-tracking component, off = disables o-tracking

name: articleComments
description: Show comments on articles

name: capiV2LinkedDataOrganisationHeader
description: Market Data Summary subheader for organisations

name: dummyFlag
description: Please don't delete this flag. It's used for testing and development. The owner, charlie.mccarthy@ft.com, doesn't exist.

name: barrier
description: on = users will see a barrier when they cannot access content, off = users will mostl likely get a broken experience if they cannot access content

name: liveStreams
description: Show 'load new stories' button on stream pages

name: articleScrollDepthTracking
description: Add scroll depth tracking to articles

name: gridTrialBarrier
description: on = show grid-based trial barrier with offers on it.  off = show simple anonymous barrier

name: nInstrumentation
description: on = enables the n-instrumentation component, off = disables n-instrumentation

name: b2cMessagePrompt
description: Enables the B2C message prompt

name: myftProductTourPromo
description: on = display page features promoting the myFT product tour, off = show no product tour promos

name: frontPageHeaderMarketsData
description: Display markets data in the header

name: myftLists
description: on = UI and navigation for myFT lists (formerly known as clippings) feature is displayed, off = show no trace of my myFT lists feature

name: krux
description: on = enables krux behaviour tracking, off = disables krux behaviour tracking

name: aaa
description: Dummy multivariant test used to calibrate the tool

name: cookieMessage
description: Controls whether the cookie message should be displayed

name: myFtApi
description: Toggles myFT features (sort of). Off = MyFT page goes into maintenence mode, and some* myFT buttons don't display. (* this is currently in a bit of a mess. Some myFT buttons are wrapped in checks for myFtApi AND myFtApiWrite but most just check for myFtApiWrite. Ideally myFtApi would turn off all myFT API reads and writes, and myFtApiWrite would just turn off the writes. There's a card on myFT's backlog to fix this. In the meantime, in order to go full myFT maintenance mode, turn off both the myFtApi and myFtApiWrite flags)

name: articleFollowPrimayTag
description: on: follow button beside primary tag, off: no follow button

name: streamOpenArticleInStream
description: on: allow article to be opened in stream, off: do not

name: aa
description: An A/A test is an experiment where the two alternatives are exactly the same. This helps to calibrate the A/B test tool.

name: articleShareButtons
description: on: articles have share buttons, off: articles don't have share buttons

name: articleSuggestedRead
description: Suggested reads on articles (read next, suggested reads and suggested topic)

name: streamFiltersAndFacets
description: Filters and facets for stream pages.

name: searchSuggestions
description: on: displays topics related to a given search; off: no search suggestions provided

name: kruxRubiconIntegration
description: Includes a tracking pixel to match Krux User ID to Rubicon User ID for programmatic ads

name: kruxGoogleIntegration
description: Includes a tracking pixel to match Krux User ID to Doubleclick User ID for display ads

name: kruxAcxiomIntegration
description: Includes a tracking pixel do user matching for one of Krux's 3rd party Data providers

description: Includes a tracking pixel do user matching for one of Krux's 3rd party Data providers

name: kruxIXIIntegration
description: Includes a tracking pixel do user matching for one of Krux's 3rd party Data providers

name: kruxExelateIntegration
description: Includes a tracking pixel do user matching for one of Krux's 3rd party Data providers

name: kruxAdAdvisorIntegration
description: Includes a tracking pixel do user matching for one of Krux's 3rd party Data providers

name: syndicationNewUsersAwaiting
description: This flag is used as a way to stagger user opt-ins for the new syndication system. When this flag is on, if a userâ€™s UUID is in the list of awaiting users in config vars, they will see the new syndication system (as opposed to the current, third-party system). Afterwards, their UUID can be moved over to the main list of UUIDs in config vars and this flag can be switched off again. This mechanism makes releasing to new (specific) users much less stressful for devs :-)
